title: [Self-Directed] Reinforcement Learning-Based Autonomous Vehicle Network Optimization Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematics (calculus, probability), programming fundamentals, and foundational machine learning theory
context.additional_context: Students lack prior knowledge of mmWave communication and autonomous driving systems but are interested in solving real-life problems through mathematical modeling. Project-based collaborative learning environment.

learning_goals: Students can design a model that dynamically optimizes communication parameters (frame/symbol count) for autonomous vehicles using reinforcement learning algorithms.
Students can apply metrics to evaluate system performance by analyzing queue state information (QSI) and channel state information (CSI) in mmWave communication environments.
Students can analyze the trade-off between communication stability and detection accuracy (velocity resolution) in autonomous vehicle networks using simulation tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
